column4: hey what are the terminals used for from ctrl+alt F1 to ctrl+alt F6 or 7?
Technically, there are more - up to tty63
right but are they used differently?
The ones after tty7 are simply not used by default. (They are possible to use though)
when I reach past tty7 it goes back up to windows
In the default configuration, tty1-6 are terminal logins, tty7 is X, and the rest are not allocated.
I see that F1 is different from the others... to me it seem like they meant for some its own reason?
tty1 is the first one, which means it is selected on boot (until you or GDM change it).
And kernel messages go to the currently selected tty.
GNOME Display Manager - the app that shows graphical login screen, runs GNOME or whatever, etc.
so tty1 is safe to use?
Yes, all of them are safe to use.
There are commands 'openvt' for running bash on an unused tty; 'chvt' for changing ttys; and so on.

a little correction... F1 is just the key on your keyboard, which happens to switch to the first tty. The actual things are usually called either consoles, terminals, or ttys. (Sometimes "virtual" ones)
Anyway, tty1 is safe to use.
Ok thanks. I was searching for the information for that but I seem cannot find it.
